name: TRAPPER 300
notes:
Prototype built for the 1/4 ton World Championships at Deauville in 1975 ('Fred Junior').
Around 180 Trapper 300''s of two interior versions were constructed, many being completed from kits. A considerable portion of these were sold in Poland, but some also went to USA and Hong Kong. 
Keels were originally available in lead or cast iron, the majority being the cast iron version. A number were later modified with a bulb on the bottom of the keel to increase righting moment.
Many different engines were fitted, although the majority fitted by Trapper Yachts were Yanmar YSE8.
